data.title: Harrison: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Harrison is a surname that has a rich history and is widely used across the world. The name is believed to have originated from Germanic roots. Read on.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Harrison

The patronymic last name Harrison is a popular one that originated in Northern England. Originally from Germany, the name Harrison means ‚Äòhouse ruler.‚Äô the Medieval English pronunciation of Henry is represented by the phrase ‚Äúson of Harry.‚Äù

Henry, a name that arrived in England via the French during the Norman Conquest, has a pet version called Harry. The words ‚Äúhaim‚Äù and ‚Äúric,‚Äù which in Old German meant ‚Äúhome‚Äù and ‚Äústrength,‚Äù respectively, are the roots of the French Henri.

Since the US government started tracking naming trends in 1880, Harrison has been used as a given male name in America. The family name Harrison most likely originated in at least 1841, when William Harrison, the ninth president of the United States, was elected, or maybe in 1811 when he rose to fame as a result of the Battle of Tippecanoe.

Harrison represents a more modern variation of Henry and can easily condense to the delightfully retro name Harry. After the Normans brought this name to England, the name Henry gave rise to several pet names and nicknames, including Harry, Hal, Hann, and Hankin. Another way to spell this name is Harryson, Harrisson, or Harrysson. Early records indicate that some households may have used Harrison and Harris‚Äôs surnames interchangeably.

The popularity of Harrison gradually decreased throughout the 20th century, and in 1977 it nearly disappeared entirely from the charts.

This name is also popular in the fictional world. In The CW‚Äôs Arrowverse series, particularly the television show The Flash, Tom Cavanagh played the fictional character, Harrison Wells. In literature, American author Kurt Vonnegut published his satirical dystopian science-fiction short tale ‚ÄúHarrison Bergeron‚Äù in October 1961. The tale, which had first appeared in The Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction, was later collected by the author in 1968 under the title Welcome to the Monkey House.

Before you finalize your baby‚Äôs name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it‚Äôs presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it‚Äôs popularity. A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Harrison‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Harrison‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Harrison Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Harrison is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Harrison‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
